title: Stream agent output to disk continuously, not just at completion
description:
Currently agent output is buffered in memory (16KB cap) and only written to run record at completion. If process becomes zombie or crashes, output is lost.

Fix: Write stdout/stderr to disk as it streams in.

Files to modify:
- app/Services/ProcessManager.php - already has file-based output, ensure it's used
- app/Process/AgentProcess.php - add file paths, write incrementally
- app/Commands/ConsumeCommand.php - ensure using the file-based capture

Implementation:
1. On spawn, create .fuel/processes/{taskId}/stdout.log and stderr.log
2. In poll() or getIncrementalOutput(), append to files immediately
3. On completion, copy final output to run record but files are already there
4. On zombie/crash, output is preserved in files

This ensures output survives process failures.

title: Add 'refactor' as valid task type
description:
Add 'refactor' to the list of valid task types.

Current types: bug, feature, task, epic, chore, docs, test
Add: refactor

Files to modify:
- app/Enums/TaskType.php (or wherever types are defined)
- Any validation logic that checks task types

Refactor is distinct from chore - it specifically means 'improve code structure without changing behavior'. Aligns with conventional commits (refactor:).

title: Add browser/screenshot capability for agents to verify frontend work
description:
Agents working on frontend tasks can't verify their work visually. Add capability for agents to:

1. Launch a headless browser (Puppeteer, Playwright, or similar)
2. Take screenshots of specified URLs/pages
3. View the screenshots to verify visual changes

Options to explore:
- Puppeteer/Playwright via Node.js subprocess
- browsershot PHP package (uses Puppeteer under the hood)
- Selenium with headless Chrome
- Built-in MCP browser tools if available

Integration points:
- Add as a fuel command: `fuel screenshot <url> [--output=path]`
- Or integrate into agent prompts: 'Use fuel screenshot to verify your changes'
- Consider video recording for complex interactions

This enables visual regression testing and lets agents self-verify frontend work.

title: Add --force flag to remove command to skip confirmation
description:
The 'fuel remove' command currently always prompts for confirmation, which breaks automation and piping.

Add a --force (-f) flag that skips the confirmation prompt.

File to modify: app/Commands/RemoveCommand.php

Changes:
1. Add option: $this->addOption('force', 'f', InputOption::VALUE_NONE, 'Skip confirmation prompt')
2. In handle(): if ($this->option('force')) skip the confirm() call
3. Keep existing behavior (prompt) as default for safety

Example usage:
- fuel remove f-xxxx --force  # No prompt
- fuel remove f-xxxx -f       # No prompt  
- fuel remove f-xxxx          # Prompts (current behavior)

title: Add --backlog as alias for --someday in fuel add command
description:
The 'fuel add' command uses --someday to add items to backlog, but --backlog is more intuitive.

Add --backlog as an alias that behaves identically to --someday.

File to modify: app/Commands/AddCommand.php

Changes:
1. Add option: $this->addOption('backlog', null, InputOption::VALUE_NONE, 'Add to backlog (alias for --someday)')
2. In handle(): check $this->option('backlog') || $this->option('someday')
3. Keep --someday for backwards compatibility

Example usage:
- fuel add 'Future idea' --backlog    # Same as --someday
- fuel add 'Future idea' --someday    # Still works

title: Automated run scoring by review agent
description:
Review agent scores completed runs automatically (not manual human ratings).

Scoring criteria:
- Follow-up fixes needed (fewer = better)
- Tests passed first time
- Code quality (linting, patterns)
- Task completion accuracy vs description

Config additions:
- reviewer: agent that reviews completed work and scores
- Could be cheaper model for cost efficiency

Storage: scores table in agent.db
Uses: agent comparison, routing optimization, cost/quality analysis

Related: Phase 4 (Auto-Review)
